qas.question: In which village does tradition believe Virgil was born?
In which cities did Virgil attend schools?
What other career did Virgil consider?
Which type of family do scholars generally believe Virgil belonged to?
Does Macrobius believe Virgil's father came from a distinguished or humble background?
What kind of family did Macrobius have?
What city did Virgil live the longest in?
What career did Virgil's father have?

context: The tradition holds that Virgil was born in the village of <a0_0>Andes<a0_0/>, near Mantua in Cisalpine Gaul. Analysis of his name has led to beliefs that he descended from earlier Roman colonists. Modern speculation ultimately is not supported by narrative evidence either from his own writings or his later biographers. Macrobius says that Virgil's father was of a <a4_0>humble<a4_0/> background; however, scholars generally believe that Virgil was from <b6_0>an <a3_0>equestrian landowning<a3_0/> family<b6_0/> which could afford to give him an education. He attended schools in <a1_0>Cremona, <b8_0>Mediolanum<b8_0/>, <b7_0>Rome<b7_0/> and <b5_0>Naples<b5_0/><a1_0/>. After considering briefly a career in <a2_0><b9_0>rhetoric and law<b9_0/><a2_0/>, the young Virgil turned his talents to poetry.
